intro: Triumfetta mitchellii, commonly known as Mitchell's triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Triumfetta mitchellii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Aboriginal medicine.
